title: Drawing, Design for Corner Cabinet in Mahogany and Inlay, Plan and Elevation, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Corner Cabinet in Mahogany and Inlay, Plan and Elevation
medium: Pen and black ink on thin cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper center and lower right of elevation: Leaded Glass Doors / Two Glass Shelves in Cupboards / One Shelf in cupd [sic]; at lower right of sheet: CORNER CHINA CABINET / of Mahogany & Inlay; at center of plan: PLAN
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Elevation: tall cabinet raised on 3 straight tapering legs; closed cupboard with inlaid patera medallion topped by tall cupboard  with glass doors.  Plan: triangular shape of cabinet shown; slightly slanted corners.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Corner Cabinet in Mahogany and Inlay, Plan and Elevation, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-208
